title: (x) "Custom Upholstery" script in Anthropologie - Berthold Script {Mike F}
content:
Can someone help me ID the script font used  
on the title of this month’s Anthropologie? :))

Thanks so much!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081010003554im_/http:/typophile.com/files/anthro2_5079.jpg)

 [‹ I wanna know what LOVE is](http://web.archive.org/web/20081010003554/http:/typophile.com/node/27607 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Squarish slanted Titletown - Serpentine {Mike Y} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081010003554/http:/typophile.com/node/32873 "Go to next forum topic")
author: dzgnchic

comments.content:
Hi there:

This is a logo developed from Linotype English Script:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081010003554im_/http:/typophile.com/files/custom_3482.gif)

On closer inspection, the ’ribbon’ connected to lowecase h is an adjunct. Many joins are also deleted.

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/english-script/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081010003554/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/english-script/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/english-script/")

Enjoy!

Mike Diaz

PS... I love Anthopologie too!!!!

eehehehe~

Anthropologie girls are the cutest~!! ;)

Thanks Mike!

Do you guys know if there’s another version with a slight variation? It seems like a light version of English Script. The s, u, p and m are just slightly different... sowry for being so detailed...

;)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081010003554im_/http:/typophile.com/files/sample_6513.jpg)

I don’t think it is English Script - ALL characters are different.

I don’t know what it is either. Sorry I couldn’t be more positive.

Nick Cooke
Perhaps Coles can chime in on this one...

I found [this version by ScanGraphic](http://web.archive.org/web/20081010003554/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=SG.8411.0.0&sampleText=Custom+Upholstery) on Fontshop.
